clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Post Sphincterotomy-bleeding by Epinephrine-injection Versus Insertion of an Plastic Stent
clinical_study.official_title: Retrospective Study on Treatment of Post Sphincterotomy-bleeding by Epinephrine-injection Versus Insertion of an Endoprosthesis: a Single Center Experience Over 16 Years With 5698 ERCPs

brief_summary.textblock:
Post sphinterotomy-bleeding (PSB) occurs in 1-2 % of Endosocpic Retrograde Cholangiopancreaticography (ERCP) and usually needs no blood transfusion after endoscopic therapy but can be life-threatening in some rare cases.
There are no prospective comparative studies concerning the endoscopic treatment of PSB due to the rarity of the incident.
Insertion of an endoprosthesis in the common bile duct may be more effective than Epinephrin-injection into the papilla which is the therapy of first choice.
A retrospective single centre analysis on both used methods over a study period of 16 years shall be performed.

detailed_description.textblock:
Post sphinterotomy-bleeding (PSB) occurs in 1-2 % of Endosocpic Retrograde Cholangiopancreaticography (ERCP) and usually needs no blood transfusion after endoscopic therapy but can be life-threatening in some rare cases.
The increasing use of antiplatelet and/or anticoagulant therapies enhances the risk of PSB.
There are no prospective comparative studies concerning the endoscopic treatment of PSB due to the rarity of the incident.
Insertion of an endoprosthesis in the common bile duct may be more effective than Epinephrin-injection into the papilla which is the therapy of first choice.
A retrospective single centre analysis on both used methods over a study period of 16 years shall be performed.
In detail, clinical success and safety of the procedure, re-bleeding rate, number of re-interventions and days of hospital stay will be analysed.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the successful endocopic treatment of post sphincterotomy-bleeding up to 30 days in the follow up
primary_outcome.description: No re-bleeding occurs in the follow-up that requirers a further interventional treatment of re-bleeding (any endoscopic, radiological embolization or surgery): yes/no

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the endoscopic treatment of post-sphincterotomy-bleeding up to three months
primary_outcome.description: Amount of endoscopic re-interventions (further endoscopic therapy of re-bleeding of the papilla, removal or exchange of the plastic stent): number (n)

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the endoscopic treatment of post-sphincterotomy-bleeding up to 30 days
primary_outcome.description: Hospital stay (days) after treatment of post sphincterotomy-bleeding

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the endoscopic treatment of post-sphincterotomy-bleeding up to three days
secondary_outcome.description: Any kind of post ERCP-pancreatitis that occurs after treatment of post sphincterotomy-bleeding and can be refered to this treatment (patients with cannulated pancreatic duct are excluded): yes/no

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From treatment of post-sphincterotomy-bleeding up to three days
secondary_outcome.description: Any kind of cholestasis measured by an increase of bilirubin level (mg/dl) after the treatment of post-sphincterotomy-bleeding that can be refered to this treatment (patients with unsuccesful endoscopic drainage/stone extraction are excluded): yes/no

arm_group.description: Diluted Epinephrin (1:100) in small amounts from 1 to 5 ml is injected into apex of the papilla to stop post sphincterotomy-bleeding
A plastic stent (diameter: 8-11,5F and length of 50 -100mm) is inserted into the common bile duct to stop post sphincterotomy-bleeding

study_pop.textblock: All documented ERCPs in the single centre institution database are systematically screened for post sphincterotomy-bleeding in the time period from 1.1.2002 to 29.10.2018

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Post sphincterotomy bleeding (PSB) of the papilla (time frame: from procedure up to ten days after the procedure)
- Treatment of PSB by epinephrine-injection or insertion of a plastic stent into the common bile duct
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant and/or lactating women
- Complete patient record is not available
